phys package¶

Submodules¶

phys.light module¶

phys.light.E_from_wavelength(wavelength)¶

Converts a wavelength in meters to E in joules.

class phys.light.PhotonObject(attrs={})¶

Bases: phys.Object

Represents a simple photon. Constrained to require an energy (E) and a velocity whose Euclidean norm is the speed of light.

class phys.light.ScatterDeleteStep(n, A)¶

Bases: phys.Step

Step that scatters photon objects from a simulation by removing them. Assumes that the simulation composes the entirety of the medium and has a constant number density and cross-sectional area.

run(sim)¶

Runs this step, and will either run it in native Python or OpenCL.

class phys.light.ScatterMeasureStep(out_fn, measure_n=True, measure_locs=[])¶

Bases: phys.MeasureStep

Measures the number of photons that cross through a series of planes. Each plane should be defined with a 3D numpy double array, with the coordinates not defining the location of the plane set to numpy.nan.

run(sim)¶

Measures some aspect of the simulation at this step.

class phys.light.ScatterSignMeasureStep(out_fn, measure_n=True)¶

Bases: phys.MeasureStep

Measures the number of objects with a strictly positive coordinate at each step with regards to x, y, and z coordinates.

run(sim)¶

Measures some aspect of the simulation at this step.

class phys.light.ScatterSphericalStep(n, A, wavelength_dep_scattering=False)¶

Bases: phys.Step

Step that scatters photons spherically, according to a defined number density (n) and a defined cross-sectional area (A).

If the optional param wavelength_dep_scattering is set to True, then the probability of scattering will then be proportional to ((h * c) / E_wave)^-4 (i.e. divide by the wavelength to the power of 4)

run(sim)¶

Runs the simulation either in native Python or in OpenCL

class phys.light.TracePathMeasureStep(out_fn, trace_type=<class 'phys.Object'>, id_info_fn=<function TracePathMeasureStep.<lambda>>)¶

Bases: phys.MeasureStep

Traces the path of object. If the object does not exist at any point, then the value ‘nan;nan;nan’ is traced. Otherwise the current coordinates are printed as a string.

run(sim)¶

Measures some aspect of the simulation at this step.

terminate(sim)¶

Turns the data collected into a 2D matrix of coordinate vectors. The first row will be the recorded times (useful if we write the data to a CSV).

phys.light.generate_photons(n, bins=100, dist='gauss', min=0, max=1, dir=[299792458.0, 0, 0])¶

Generates a collection of rays according to a distribution. Works as follows: 1. Generates a distribution of E according to dist. 2. Multiplies the quantity of rays desired per bin by the resulting distribution, then generates that number of rays per bin. This number is floored. 3. Returns a list of the generated rays.

Acceptable distributions: - const: Generates n photons for each bin of photons. - gauss: Generates up to n photons for each bin of photons according to the Gaussian distribution centered around the average of the two. - loglin: Generates a distribution of photons such that the log of n is directly proportional to the log of the wavelength.

phys.newton module¶

class phys.newton.NewtonianKinematicsStep¶

Bases: phys.Step

Moves all objects according to Newtonian kinematics.

run(sim)¶

Runs this step in native Python, updating each object’s position (r) and change in position (dr)

Module contents¶

class phys.MeasureStep(out_fn=None)¶

Bases: phys.Step

run(sim)¶

Measures some aspect of the simulation at this step.

terminate(sim)¶

If there is an output file, saves to that. Otherwise does nothing.

class phys.Object(attrs={})¶

Bases: object

Represents a generic object in the simulation. Inheriting subclasses will add defining features.

class phys.Simulation(params={})¶

Bases: threading.Thread

Represents a simulation that runs on a separate thread. Contains a number of attributes, holds objects, and applies steps in the order they are given. Must be started using start().

add_obj(obj)¶

Adds an object to the list of current objects in the simulation.

add_objs(objs)¶

Adds a list of objects to the list of current objects in the simulation.

add_step(idx, step)¶

Adds a new step to the simulation. Index must be unique.

get_device_info()¶

Generates a dictionary identifying each platform and all associated devices. Properties for devices are listed if the associated OpenCL feature is supported on that device.

get_state()¶

Gets the current state of the simulation. Locks if the user states the simulation should lock before getting the state.

remove_obj(obj)¶

Removes an object from this simulation.

remove_step(idx)¶

Removes a step if the simulation is not running. Otherwise raises a RuntimeError.

run()¶

Runs the simulation using threading as defined by threading.Thread. Sets t, dt = 0, repeatedly iterates through each step of the simulation until the exit condition is met. Then calls each step’s terminate function and stops.

set_dev()¶

Sets the environment variable PYOPENCL_CTX to the string id so that OpenCL will default to the device with that corresponding id.

class phys.Step¶

Bases: object

run(sim)¶
terminate(sim)¶
class phys.UpdateTimeStep(fn)¶

Bases: phys.Step

Basic class for updating the time step. Does this according to a function that is passed when this step is initialized.

run(sim)¶

Called when the simulation is run to update it’s current time and change in time.
